Speaker: OSONO
Dialogue: Kiki you're just in time. It's a customer. There's someone here who needs something delivered.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Really? I'll be right there!

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Map...

Speaker: OSONO
Dialogue: This is a regular customer of the shop. When you came up in our conversation she said it's just perfect.

Speaker: MAKI
Dialogue: What a cute witch!

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: My name is Kiki.

Speaker: MAKI
Dialogue: I'd like you to deliver this. I wonder if it will get there by this evening?

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: MAKI
Dialogue: It's a birthday gift for my nephew. Something came up at work and I can't make it to the party.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Where shall I deliver it?

Speaker: JIJI
Dialogue: It's me!

Speaker: MAKI
Dialogue: I wonder if it's too far?

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: I can fly there in a straight line.

Speaker: MAKI
Dialogue: What about the fee?

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Well I haven't decided yet.

Speaker: MAKI
Dialogue: Do you think this would be enough?

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: It's so much. Thank you!

Speaker: TOMBO
Dialogue: Isn't that neat?!

Speaker: OSONO
Dialogue: If only I could fly too...

Speaker: TOMBO
Dialogue: Lady do you know that girl?!

Speaker: JIJI
Dialogue: Kiki how high do you plan on flying?

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Well this is my first job--the police won't bother me up here.

Speaker: JIJI
Dialogue: I thought you were making a delivery to an angel.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: It's on the other side of that cape. Here we go!

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Jiji I like this town.

Speaker: JIJI
Dialogue: It's too soon to make up your mind.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: But now I can write a letter to Mother.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: A flock of geese! How beautiful! They're going in the same direction we are!

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: I wonder what's wrong?

Speaker: JIJI
Dialogue: They said a big wind is coming!

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: What?!

Speaker: JIJI
Dialogue: They're saying 'Let's fly higher.'

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Oh no!!

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: This won't do! I'm sorry I'm sorry! Please excuse me! I wasn't going to steal your eggs!

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Wow that was scary!

Speaker: JIJI
Dialogue: Well it was your fault. After all they warned you about the wind.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: You're right. Aren't they something? Look how high they're flying using that wind.

Speaker: JIJI
Dialogue: Kiki it's gone!!

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: You're right! Oh no!!

Speaker: JIJI
Dialogue: It must have happened when we fell.

Speaker: JIJI
Dialogue: They're saying 'The egg-thief is back again'!

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Oh no. What shall we do?!

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Ohhh!...My broom. Stop it! Stop it! Hey stop it!!

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: What a problem. They're still kicking up a fuss...

Speaker: JIJI
Dialogue: Ah a witch's standing has really fallen. Crows used to be retainers to witches.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: But that was a long time ago. The only thing we can do is wait until sunset and return quietly and search.

Speaker: JIJI
Dialogue: But then we'll be late for our delivery.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Jiji we have to do this as a last resort.

Speaker: JIJI
Dialogue: This won't work!

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Please. I'll come and rescue you as soon as I find it.

Speaker: JIJI
Dialogue: Is that the house?

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Uh-huh. Now don't move.

Speaker: JIJI
Dialogue: How about breathing?

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: As little as possible.

Speaker: KETTO
Dialogue: It's Auntie's present! How weird!

Speaker: KETTO'S
Dialogue: It took you a long time didn't it? My sister called MOTHER so we were expecting you.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: I'm sorry. Ah...Would you sign for it please?

Speaker: KETTO
Dialogue: Mother is it all right if I transfer the canary?

Speaker: KETTO'S
Dialogue: Yes but be careful not to let it get away. MOTHER

Speaker: KETTO
Dialogue: Okay.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Thank you very much.

Speaker: KETTO
Dialogue: Now stay calm Pitchi. Hey you're not getting away!

Speaker: JIJI
Dialogue: Kiki hurry!

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: What am I going to do? It should be around here somewhere. There it is!

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Excuse me please! Is anyone here? Excuse me!

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: Yes...I can't stop now. Would you come up here?

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: That stuffed black cat in the window. It's something I lost.

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: You're a good birdie aren't you. Now don't move. I found it in the forest a little while ago.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: May I have it back?

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: Just a minute; I don't want to stop right now. That's good. Aren't you pretty.

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: Well if that's the case why didn't you say so earlier? I just thought it was kind of cute.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Thank you! Oh it's ripped!

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: It's the crow's fault. They were making a fuss at the time.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: What shall I do? It belongs to a customer.

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: How about a trade-off?

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: So you're on your own at 13? I think that's great--I like the idea!

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Ah can it be fixed?

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: I told you leave it to me.

Speaker: KETTO'S
Dialogue: Ketto! Ketto hurry and take a bath! The guests will MOTHER be here soon! KET-TO!!

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: Finished!

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: OK hurry and go rescue Jiji.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: But I haven't finished cleaning.

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: That's plenty. Hurry hurry!

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: KETTO
Dialogue: Jeff is really a funny one.

Speaker: KETTO'S
Dialogue: : It's so comical; Jeff has taken such a liking to that MOTHER stuffed cat he won't let go of it.

Speaker: GUEST
Dialogue: A: I wonder if he thinks it's a puppy?

Speaker: GUEST
Dialogue: B: If Maki hears that she'll be angry.

Speaker: KETTO
Dialogue: It's OK I'm going to give it to Jeff.

Speaker: KETTO'S
Dialogue: Why don't you write a letter to Aunt Maki? MOTHER

Speaker: KETTO
Dialogue: Okay.

Speaker: GUEST
Dialogue: A: Jeff has really aged hasn't he? You have to be nice to him Ketto.

Speaker: KETTO
Dialogue: But all he does is sleep.

Speaker: GUEST
Dialogue: A: Isn't that the truth!

Speaker: KETTO'S
Dialogue: Ketto Jeff wants to go out. Open the door for him. MOTHER

Speaker: KETTO
Dialogue: Okay. When you're done close the door yourself.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: JIJI!!

Speaker: JIJI
Dialogue: You're late!

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Speaker: JIJI
Dialogue: He's the one who saved me. He says he'll replace the stuffed cat.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Can you do this favor for us?

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Are you still feeling stiff?

Speaker: JIJI
Dialogue: I'm hungry.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: That's right. And I'm dead tired too. But it was a wonderful day. And you know the person who found the stuffed cat for me wants to paint a picture with me as a model.

Speaker: JIJI
Dialogue: Nude?

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Stupid!
